text:
ing roles of surgeons and CT in the acutely unwell

--- Page 747 ---
733
Radiology
Fig 16.16 Triple-phase CT abdomen, cropped to show the pancreas. Top panel—unenhanced 
image, middle panel—arterial phase of contrast medium to look for pseudocysts and pa-
renchymal enhancement, bottom panel—portal venous phase to look at veins. The history 
here was also central abdominal pain with a non-peritonitic abdomen. The CT shows an en-
larged pancreatic head with fat stranding around the duodenopancreatic groove (‘groove 
pancreatitis’), and two small areas of ﬂ uid attenuation posteriorly, likely to be pseudocysts.
Top panel courtesy of Dr Edmund Godfrey.
